section.name: Entry Point
section.p: JavaDocBuilder is the entry point to QDox. It is responsible for parsing source code, resolving imports and storing the data.
To use it, all you need to do is call the default constructor.

section.name: Reading Source Files
section.p: Java source code can then be added to the JavaDocBuilder. Source can either be read file at a time through a Reader or an entire source tree can be added recursively.

section.name: Resolving Class Names
section.p: In order to resolve classes that have been imported using a wildcard (e.g. import java.util.*;), the ClassLibrary must be aware of other classes used in the project.
ClassLibrary has 3 ways to resolve classes:

ul.li: By looking at other sources that have been added.
By looking in the current classpath (including the standard JRE classes).
By looking at additional ClassLoaders specified at runtime.

section.p: The first two are automaticly set by JavaDocBuilder. In most cases this shall be sufficient, however in some situations you may want resolve the full classes in external libraries.
To resolve classes from different ClassLoaders (e.g. 3rd party Jar files), the addClassLoader() method must be called on the ClassLibrary.
It is important that additional ClassLoaders are added before any source files are parsed.

section.name: Navigating The Model
section.p: Now the files have been parsed, move on to navigating the model.
